overview: Students negotiate an individual project relating to education with an individual supervisor. The project includes a critical review of relevant academic and research literature and a research project relating to educational practice. Students also participate in regular online activities to support them and build their skills as they develop their project, analyse research literature and data, and write up their research report.
ilo: Design a research project with appropriate methodology and research techniques
Analyse, critique and synthesise knowledge in a particular field in education
Analyse and interpret relevant research data
Identify the theoretical context of an issue of concern in education and articulate its application to the issue
Evaluate potential research methodologies and ethical considerations, and make judgements about their appropriateness for a given project
Demonstrate a capacity to conduct research projects
Engage in reflective, critical discussion of the research in an area of particular interest.
generic_skills: Be skilled communicators who can effectively articulate and justify relationships between theory, research and teaching.
Be flexible and able to adapt to change through knowing how to learn using research processes.
Understand the significance of developing their practice on the basis of research evidence.
Work in teams with skills in cooperation, communication and negotiation to engage in reflective and critical discussion of research in education.
Have a conscious personal and social values base and apply this to their work.

Prerequisites.content: Admission into one of the following: MC-EDEBT Master of Education in Evidence-Based Teaching, MC-CLINTCH Master of Clinical Teaching
A minimum of a H2A average, or equivalent
Completion of a minimum of 50 credit points of study
Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)CodeNameTeaching periodCredit PointsEDUC90848Applied Research MethodologyTerm 3 (Online)Term 1 (Online)12.5

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours, regular online or telephone meetings with supervisor
